etymologies: mid 19th century. From electro- + biology. Compare French électrobiologie

definitions: A branch of biology which deals with electrical phenomena in living organisms.
Mesmerism, especially as inducing a state of suggestibility or as attributed to an electro-vital force.

notes.text: Originally applied to a form of mesmerism in which a state of hypnotic suggestibility was induced by asking the subject to hold and gaze at a small disc of copper and zinc.
